message: My sleep has been very restless lately.

replies.text: Oh no, why are you not sleeping well?

message: I am being taunted by naughty lytwings at night. At least that is what Rigmor tells me. They play with my hair while I sleep, and tangle it into fairy-lock knots. Every morning I wake up tired, and I spend an hour brushing out the knots. I don't know what to do!

replies.text: I am sorry to hear that, but I cannot help you right now.
That sounds awful, can I help in any way?

message: I understand. I guess I will just have to live with their mischief, and hope that I don't lose my hair, or my sanity!

replies.text: Good luck.

message: You would be willing to help me? I would be so grateful if you could make them leave me alone.

replies.text: N

message: Have you found them yet?

replies.text: Not yet. I still need to go talk with Rigmor to find out more.
Not yet. I am still looking for their mushroom patch. You wouldn't know where it is, perhaps?
I did, they asked that I bring them a gift of apples and strawberries.

message: Please tell me you have good news?

replies.text: They accepted the gift and will allow me to talk to them.
The lytwings are upset that you took their mushrooms. I pleaded with them, and am now waiting on their decision.
I have, and they agreed to stop pestering you if I help cut down a tree for them.
The lytwings changed their minds, and are now thinking of something else they want instead.
They now want four bottles of mead. They sure are giving me the run around today!
They took the mead, but said they need something else.
They want a dozen wild flowers.
They took the wild flowers ...
The lytwings ask that you make a promise to never pick mushrooms from their fairy ring again.
I will take your ring to them at once!
I gave them your ring, they are busy discussing it now.

message: Oh that is great news! If you need an axe, check with Jakrar, my father, over there.

replies.text: N

message: Please keep me updated.

replies.text: I will.

message: Thank you so much for helping me with the lytwings!

replies.text: You are welcome!

message: Okay thanks for letting me know. Don't let them wait too long.

replies.text: N

message: Oh wonderful! An odd request nonetheless.

replies.text: I better go and find those fruit.
Where can I find apples and strawberries?

message: You can buy apples at the Fallhaven tavern. Not sure about strawberries though.

replies.text: Okay, thanks anyway.

message: Oh no, they sound very difficult to deal with. I hope it gets better.

replies.text: Thank you.

message: I am so sorry.

replies.text: N

message: You have done so much for me already. I will understand if you want to quit, I won't blame you.

replies.text: I want to see this through.
The lytwings are driving me insane. I thought about this, and I can't help you any more. I am sorry.

message: You are too kind!

replies.text: N

message: I appreciate your help either way.

replies.text: Goodbye.

message: Oh please tell me that is the end of it?

replies.text: I'm afraid not, they still want more.

message: Of course! anything!

replies.text: You have to make this promise to a piece of jewellery, which I will take back to them.

message: I know, I will promise on this ring I'm wearing. It belonged to my mother, and it's dear to me, but I will do anything to stop the lytwings!

replies.text: I hope this works.

message: I made a promise to the ring, here take it to the lytwings!

replies.text: I will, right away!

message: There is nothing else to be done, and I will have to live with the lytwings tormenting me until my last day.
So ... what did they say?

replies.text: The lytwings finally agreed to leave you in peace.

message: I cannot thank you enough, $playername. You have saved my sanity!

replies.text: Unfortunately they kept your mother's ring (Lie).
They used their magic on your ring, and asked that I give it back to you.

message: That is okay. I did not expect to get it back.

replies.text: N

message: After everything you have done for me ... I want you to keep it. Please, I insist!

replies.text: That is very generous, I won't forget it.

message: I can't say that I have noticed it. A few days ago I was picking mushrooms to the west of here.
They sure are a greedy bunch!

replies.text: N

message: Are you sure that you want to quit?

replies.text: Yes, I want to quit.
On second thought, I want to see this through.

message: How can I help?

replies.text: Where can I find wild flowers?
I found some wild flowers, I just need a few more.
I have found a dozen wild flowers. I will take them to the lytwings.
Will this ever end?

message: Look to the south, and southeast from here. You will see the wild flowers growing next to the trees.

replies.text: N

message: Oh I hope they accept it, and I hope they are done with their silly errands.

replies.text: Me too.

message: You should talk to Rigmor, as she knows more about the lytwings than I do. She lives here in Fallhaven, just go north past the tavern.

replies.text: Okay.

message: They have, I no longer wake up with fairy-locks.

replies.text: I am happy to hear that.
I am happy to hear that.

message: But I see you are wearing the ring I gave them. You told me they kept it, which can only mean that you lied to me. You are just a common thief. Shame on you.

replies.text: But, I ... um ....

message: I see you are wearing my magical ring. I hope it serves you well, you derserved it.

replies.text: I keep it safe, and it keeps me safe in return.

message: Those flowers look perfect.
I don't, but I believe the potion merchant here in Fallhaven has some.

replies.text: Okay.

message: I take it you spoke to Arensia.

replies.text: N

message: What do you want to know?

replies.text: What do you know about lytwings?
Where can I find lytwings?
Thank you. I really need to go now.

message: Lytwings are small magical beings that are also known as the guardians of the forest, and they are known to take revenge on us when we intrude on them, or on nature.

replies.text: N

message: They are also very mischievous, and love causing trouble. They probably eat too many fermented berries, if you ask me.

replies.text: N

message: Lytwings gather near fairy rings. I suggest that you look for large mushroom patches in the woodland surrounding Fallhaven.

replies.text: N

message: The poor girl. She looks exhausted, and her hair is absolutely tousled. Will those lytwings never leave her alone?

replies.text: N

message: Hello there, stranger!

replies.text: Oh, hi. My name is $playername. Who are you?

message: Well met, $playername. I won't tell you my name, it is forbidden for otherkinds to know our names.

replies.text: N

message: Did you bring us a gift?

replies.text: Yes, here are two red apples and two strawberries.
I did not, sorry.

message: Bring us two red apples and two strawberries. Since you came without a gift, we cast on you a mystical Lytwing spell!

replies.text: I feel so ... tired.

message: Wonderful! These strawberries are so sweet. You may stay!
Hi $playername! Want to play with us?

replies.text: I'm here on behalf of Arensia. She is very upset.

message: She should be sorry! She stole our mushrooms.

replies.text: I'm sure she did not mean to steal them. She was probably just gathering mushrooms for a stew.

message: A STEW? That is unacceptable. She must be punished.

replies.text: Don't be mad, I am just trying to help. Is there anything I can do to make this right?

message: Hmmm, let us discuss this amongst ourselves. Can you give us a minute alone?

replies.text: Okay, I will wait nearby.

message: We are busy discussing the matter. Please wait a little bit longer.
We have decided to entertain your request.

replies.text: Thank you, Arensia will be happy to hear that!

message: But you have to do something for us first *giggle*.

replies.text: Oh please just let Arensia be, she meant no ill will.
Please just forgive her mistake. There is no need to prolong her suffering.
Yes of course. What do you need?

message: Suit yourself. If you won't help us, we won't help Arensia. Goodbye!
Please chop down this gnarly old tree inside our fairy circle. Can you do that for us?

replies.text: No, I am not willing to do that.
Okay, I will chop it down.

message: Hmm, this must be the tree the lytwings want chopped down. I need to get an iron axe.
Hey wait! We changed our minds. We like that tree and want to keep it.
We are having a celebration, please get us four bottles of mead. *giggle*

replies.text: I don't think so. Your demands are getting ridiculous.
Okay, fine. I will get you the mead. But you better not change your mind again.

message: Do you have our mead?

replies.text: No, sorry.
Yes, here is your mead.

message: Wonderful!

replies.text: Will you leave Arensia alone now?

message: Yes, of course we will.

replies.text: Arensia wil be very happy to hear this.

message: We just need you to do one more thing for us ...

replies.text: More? No I don't think so. This is absurd.
What do you want now?

message: For our celebrations, we would like a dozen wild flowers.

replies.text: This is getting silly. I don't want to collect flowers for you.
Okay fine. But this better be the last thing.

message: Do you have our wild flowers?

replies.text: No I don't.
Yes, here are your flowers.
Yes, here are your flowers.

message: No, you don't have enough flowers. A dozen means 12, not one less. Do you think lytwings can't count?

replies.text: I have collected enough for you. Take it or leave it.
Sorry, I'm going to look for the missing wild flowers now.

message: These are perfect. Thank you!

replies.text: Is that everything? Will you leave Arensia be?

message: Give us a minute to think about it.
Okay so after carefully considering your request ...

replies.text: Yes?

message: We have decided what would make this right ...

replies.text: Okay?

message: We want Arensia to promise not to pick our mushrooms again. And we want proof!

replies.text: I can ask her, but how can I provide proof?

message: She must give a piece of jewelry as proof of her promise. Her word would be bound to it.

replies.text: This sounds very silly.
Very well. I will go talk to Arensia.

message: Good. And remember, she has to make her promise to the jewelry.
Did you bring us Arensia's promise?

replies.text: No, I have not.
Yes, here is her promise ring.

message: This will do just fine, thank you $playername.

replies.text: I hope this settles the matter?

message: Well, I think you know what I will say next ...

replies.text: Oh no, not again!

message: We have discussed this matter and made a final decision ...

replies.text: Okay, I hope this turns out well.

message: Please tell Arensia that we have accepted her promise. We will no longer taunt her at night.

replies.text: Oh how wonderful. Thank you forest lytwings!

message: However, we have no need for a human ring. We embued it with our magical powers. Please take this ring back to Arensia.

replies.text: I will give Arensia her ring back. She will appreciate this gesture very much.

message: Hello $playername. We hope you are staying out of trouble.
It is important that you use an iron axe. That tree is cursed, and only an iron axe will work.

replies.text: Okay, I understand.
